intro: Diodia sarmentosa, commonly known as creeping diodia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Diodia sarmentosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
